response:
•Issue air quality alerts for areas downwind of wildfire smoke. 
•Cancel outdoor activities for vulnerable groups like children, elderly and those with respiratory issues.
•Monitor air quality levels frequently in areas with high smoke concentrations.
•Shift resources like firefighting equipment and personnel to areas with active wildfires.
•Educate public on health impacts of wildfire smoke exposure and steps to minimize risk.
•Research long-term solutions for mitigating effects of wildfire smoke as fire seasons worsen.
